definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: I prefer to use debit card when shop on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 我通常喜欢用提款卡在网上购物。

sentences.english: I take out my cash card .
You will notice that an ATM card for Barclays Bank is also in this envelope.
sentences.chinese: 你会注意到这个信封里还有一张巴克莱银行的提款卡。

sentences.english: I took out my cash card.
Will I have to change my ATM password?
sentences.chinese: 我必须要改变我的自动提款卡的密码吗？

sentences.english: How much does a new ATM card cost?
sentences.chinese: 一张新的自动提款卡要花多少钱？

sentences.english: Can I have a cash card too?
sentences.chinese: 我还能要一张现金提款卡吗？

sentences.english: In some cases, even credit and debit card numbers may have been stolen.
sentences.chinese: 有些甚至连信用卡号和提款卡号都被盗。

sentences.english: Do you want to apply for a ATM card?
sentences.chinese: 你是否要申请办理提款卡？

definition: identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
to withdraw money/to take money out of the bank
USB flash drive (Tw)/see also 閃存盤|闪存盘[shan3 cun2 pan2]
EasyCard, smartcard used for payment on public transport and at other businesses such as convenience stores in Taipei and surrounding areas
